abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Agricultural Research
            Project for Pakistan was successful. The primary objectives
            were achieved, the project made a major impact on civil
            works and institutional development, sustainability is
            likely under certain conditions, and both the Borrower and
            the Bank acted satisfactorily. Several lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, the National Agricultural
            Research Plan should be kept under continuous review to keep
            it aligned with the national agricultural development
            objectives. Second, training should be focused on deficient
            areas identified as a result of the needs survey. Third,
            contract research sub-projects should be properly worked out
            to accommodate the priority needs of the country. Fourth,
            there is a need for greater recognition of the linkage
            between training, technical assistance, and contract
            research. Fifth, contract research funds should not be
            utilized for infrastructure development. Sixth, a steering
            committee should be organized to regularly review
            implementation of research projects and take timely
            appropriate measures to remove bottlenecks. Seventh,
            collaborative research needs to be emphasized in future
            research projects. Eighth, Agricultural Economics Research
            should continue to be encouraged and even expanded. Ninth,
            priority setting mechanisms need to be strengthened and
            supported. Lastly, reports submitted by the expatriate
            experts should be widely circulated and made available to
            the possible beneficiaries.

Pakistan - Agricultural Research Project :
            Credit 1158 - Project Agreement - Conformed

Pakistan - Agricultural Research
            Project : Credit 1158 - Project Agreement - Conformed

docna.cdata!:
Pakistan - Agricultural Research Project :
            Credit 1158 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Pakistan - Agricultural Research
            Project : Credit 1158 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Credit would finance: (a) a
            headquarters secretariat building for the Pakistan
            Agricultural Research Council (PARC); (b) incremental staff
            and facilities for the improvement of PARC's
            administration; especially financial planning, procurement,
            audit, accounts, training, technical assistance, personnel
            and management, project implementation and supervision of
            construction of civil works; (c) technical service units at
            PARC and at the National Agricultural Research Center (NARC)
            for: collection, publication and dissemination of research
            information; maintenance and repair of laboratory equipment;
            development of the research station at NARC and supporting
            research program development in plant sciences; animal
            sciences; cereal diseases; oilseeds; agricultural
            engineering and agricultural economics; (d) supporting
            agricultural research subprojects conducted by non-PARC
            research agencies; (e) overseas and local training to M.Sc.
            and Ph.D. levels and for short career development courses
            for research personnel; and (f) technical assistance in
            management techniques and technical research program
            development and for a mid-term review of project progress.
